question_text: A technician observes that a server with redundant power supplies is reporting a fault, but the system remains fully operational. What is the MOST likely cause?
answer_options: Single power supply failure with load shifted to remaining unit
correct_answer: Single power supply failure with load shifted to remaining unit
explanation: Redundant supplies are designed to maintain full system operation if one fails. The remaining supply will take over the full load, but an alert will indicate fault status.
